TechnicalGuide.title: Technical Guide
TechnicalGuide.subtitle: Technical principles of BanaToon and FAQ
TechnicalGuide.section1_title: üõ†Ô∏è How It Works: Under the Hood
TechnicalGuide.section1_p1: The process of converting your photos and videos into webtoons with BanaToon is not just a simple filter application, but involves an advanced AI pipeline. Media uploaded by the user undergoes primary optimization (Compression & Resizing) within the browser to be converted into a form that can be transmitted quickly.
TechnicalGuide.section1_p2: For video processing, we use the HTML5 Canvas API to analyze and extract key scenes (Keyframes) in real-time on the client side. An algorithm that compares pixel-level similarity between images works to exclude duplicate frames and select only the scenes best suited for storytelling.
TechnicalGuide.section1_p3: Selected images are transmitted to the edge server via a secure encrypted channel, where Google's latest multimodal AI, Gemini Pro Vision, reverse engineers the visual elements of the image into text prompts. These prompts are then used as input for the image generation model, rebirthing them into a perfect webtoon style while maintaining the composition and emotion of the original.
TechnicalGuide.section2_intro: BanaToon is designed with a 100% Serverless Architecture to maximize scalability and performance. Instead of traditional monolithic servers, we utilize Cloudflare's edge network distributed across over 300 cities worldwide to process requests at the server closest to the user.
TechnicalGuide.section2_item1_desc: Boasts a startup speed close to 0ms without the Cold Start problem of traditional servers. All API requests are processed in a lightweight V8 engine-based Isolate environment, maintaining stable performance even with tens of thousands of concurrent users.
TechnicalGuide.section2_item2_desc: AI that understands the 'context' of an image beyond simple object recognition. It grasps subtle facial expression changes, lighting atmosphere, and narrative meaning of the background to create results at the level of 'recreation' rather than simple conversion.
TechnicalGuide.section2_item3_desc: We use D1, a distributed SQL database, to ensure data integrity. Gallery information can be retrieved in real-time without data synchronization delay from anywhere in the world, equipped with automated backup and recovery systems.
TechnicalGuide.section2_item4_desc: Object storage compatible with AWS S3, storing uploaded original images and converted results. Taking advantage of zero data transfer fees (Egress Fee), we handle high-resolution images without limits, and a Lifecycle policy is applied to automatically delete data after a certain period for security.
TechnicalGuide.faq1_a: Yes, BanaToon's basic features are currently provided completely free. Despite the high costs of AI model usage, we maintain a free service through an advertising revenue model so that more people can enjoy the fun of webtoon creation.
TechnicalGuide.faq2_a: Absolutely safe. Uploaded images are used temporarily only for the conversion process and are permanently deleted from the server after a certain period upon completion, under Cloudflare R2's Ephemeral Policy. We do not use user data for AI training.
TechnicalGuide.faq3_q: Q. Who owns the copyright of the results?
TechnicalGuide.faq3_a: Copyright of the converted images basically belongs to the user. However, legal copyright recognition of AI-generated images may vary by country's laws. BanaToon claims no rights to the generated images, so you are free to use them for personal use or SNS sharing.
TechnicalGuide.faq4_q: Q. Is sound included in video conversion?
TechnicalGuide.faq4_a: In the current version, we analyze only the 'visual elements' of the video and convert them into static webtoon cuts. Therefore, sound is not included, and we reconstruct the most dramatic moments in the video into image cuts with a story.

FAQPage.guide_desc: Check out in-depth answers about BanaToon's technical background and architecture. Explains how Cloudflare Workers, R2, D1, and Google Gemini technologies are applied.

items.q: How is BanaToon's server architecture configured?
items.a: BanaToon runs on a 100% Serverless architecture based on Cloudflare Workers. Without traditional servers (like EC2), code deployed to over 300 edge locations worldwide handles user requests at the nearest location. This eliminates infrastructure management burdens and allows automatic infinite scaling even during traffic spikes.

items.q: What AI model is used for image analysis?
items.a: We utilize Google's multimodal AI "Gemini Pro Vision" to accurately grasp the context and content of images. Instead of simply transforming pixels, Gemini understands the expressions, actions, and situations of figures in the photo as text (Captioning), and creates an optimized webtoon style generation prompt based on this.

Yes, security and privacy are top priorities. Uploaded images are encrypted and stored in Cloudflare R2 Object Storage. R2 is compatible with AWS S3 while applying strict access control policies (IAM) to prevent unnecessary data leakage.

BanaToon follows an "Ephemeral Storage Policy". After conversion is complete and the user downloads the result or saves it to the gallery, original and temporary data are physically permanently deleted within 24 hours by Cloudflare R2 Lifecycle Policy.

items.q: What technology is used for the database?
items.a: We use Cloudflare D1 (SQLite-based edge SQL DB) fully integrated with the global edge network. User metadata or session information is replicated and stored in edge nodes worldwide, not in a specific region, enabling fast data retrieval with no latency from any country.

items.q: Is there any speed degradation when processing large images?
items.a: We utilize Cloudflare Workers' edge computing capabilities to perform image resizing and format optimization (WebP conversion) at the edge server closest to the client. This minimizes data transfer to the origin server and dramatically reduces network bottlenecks.

items.q: Why choose Cloudflare ecosystem over AWS or Azure?
items.a: The biggest reason is the "Zero Egress Fee" policy and "Edge Computing without Cold Start". Due to the nature of image/video services, bandwidth costs are high, but we can save this through Cloudflare R2 to continue providing free services to users. Also, Workers' 0ms cold start maximizes user experience.

items.q: How does video webtoon conversion work?
items.a: Video processing goes through a pipeline of Frame Extraction -> Gemini Analysis -> Style Transfer. Main keyframes are extracted from the client browser (WebAssembly) or edge worker, and processed in parallel to reconstruct the video into continuous webtoon cuts. Algorithms maintaining temporal consistency are applied in this process.

items.q: Network optimization technology for global service provision?
items.a: Through Cloudflare's Anycast Network, users are automatically connected to the nearest data center geographically. Also, static assets (JS, CSS, images) are cached in CDNs worldwide, and dynamic API requests are routed via the shortest path through Workers.

items.q: How is the consistency of AI generated results maintained?
items.a: We utilize Seed fixing and ControlNet technology to maintain the same character or style. The pipeline is designed to maintain the features (Feature Map) of the initial character analyzed by Gemini while changing only the style, so that even if multiple photos are transformed, the same person can be recognized.

items.q: Are there API call limits or rate limits?
items.a: Currently, dynamic adjustment algorithms are applied according to Cloudflare Workers' rate limiting and Gemini API quotas. If traffic surges, a queue system operates to prevent server overload and guarantee stable processing.

items.q: What technical features will be added in the future?
items.a: We are preparing for Long Context analysis of long videos through the introduction of the next-generation Gemini 1.5 Pro model. Through this, we are developing a function that understands the storyline of the entire video, not just simple cut conversion, and automatically generates speech bubbles and sound effects suitable for it.
